import os import sys import re import string import base64
import MySQLdb
# Get password f = open('/root/.rocks.my.cnf','r') password = '' for line in f.readlines(): if line.split('=')[0].strip() == 'password': password = line.split('=')[1].strip() break f.close()
# Get all the local hostname that apache is # allowed to connect from. d = MySQLdb.connect(user='root', db='mysql', passwd=password, unix_socket='/var/opt/rocks/mysql/mysql.sock')
try: db = d.cursor() except: sys.exit(-1)
cmd_set = []
# Password Access for the wordpress cmd_set.append("CREATE USER 'wordpress'@'localhost'") wordpress_pass = string.strip(base64.b64encode(os.urandom(16), './')[0:16]) cmd_set.append("SET PASSWORD FOR 'wordpress'@'localhost'=PASSWORD('%s')" % wordpress_pass)
# Add wordpress password access to wordpress MySQL config file f = open('/opt/rocks/etc/.wordpress.my.cnf', 'w') f.write('[client]\n') f.write('password\t= %s\n' % wordpress_pass) f.close()
for cmd in cmd_set: db.execute(cmd)
## Fix password for wordpress DB access ## This password is different than the 'admin' password used internally ## for wordpress authoring
f = open('/var/www/html/wordpress/wp-config.php', 'r+') buffer = f.readlines() f.seek(0) passwdpattern=re.compile('DB_PASSWORD') for line in buffer: if passwdpattern.search(line): f.write("define('DB_PASSWORD','%s');\n" % wordpress_pass) else: f.write(line) f.close()
